Author: Markus#5464
Content: im sure exchanges like binance have algorithms to find those funds whereever they get transfered to and keep them in a list

Author: Markus#5464
Content: so they will always know if someone try to deposit then it gets flagged or so

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Perhaps, but you're speculating more than anything

Author: Markus#5464
Content: i just dont see how a exchange like binance would not have such systems

Author: Markus#5464
Content: they definitely have the resources to do all of that

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Binance doesn't, Chainanalysis and Elliptic does and Binance uses them.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Ciphertrace too

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Always comes back to why having fungibility is paramount and public ledgers are double-edged swords

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: there has to be mechanisms of preventing the laundering of stolen, hacked, or tainted funds.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: i like the idea of having complete privacy but i don't like the idea of trading with someone and receiving stolen funds with no way of checking that

Author: nael55#5863
Content: iirc, bisq users have had that problem

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Hence my thought on local blacklists to prevent you from transacting with a bad counterparty

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Now that would also put the burden on you to know what addresses not to do business with but that's a whole other problem to solve for

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Probably require some sort of logic about flow-through utxos and % taint with the threshold determined by the user. Just throwing ideas out.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: yea i was thinking of a scenario. a business purchasing bitcoin on the dex. the business ends up buying funds from a known business in Venezuela o any country blacklisted by the US. In a dex, they would have no way of making a decision whether the trade is "legal"

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: if the trade is fulfilled and later the business if found to have done business with a person or business in the blacklisted country, it could land them in big trouble.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: yeah, fortunately, we are still early on in the game to figure out some of these larger, downstream issues

Author: bishop#9773
Content: The forcing of KYC, especially with for US citizens, shouldn't have been surprising. It was always bound to happen and more or less a factor of timing

Author: Zoroaster#5093
Content: Im seriously considering just dumping my KMD. Too many Agama wallet problems. And the KMD token really has no utility in the ecosystem. Idk I‚Äôve always loved Komodo but I‚Äôm having a hard time finding reasons to keep it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://medium.com/@jameslee777/tokenomics-are-for-tokens-not-for-coins-3f262d0aa4b3

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe a 0% KMD tax is a bit on the low side, but that doesnt mean that charging big taxes is any good idea, especially during the high growth adoption phase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the best way to kill economic activity (other than carpet bombing)?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, for sure. but that wouldnt be considered any utility by zoroaster as he believes dPoW has no utility

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: within the komodo ecosystem, KMD is universally used for commerce

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a micro-economy, with KMD as the base currency

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you know this if you ever did work in exchange for KMD, or sold something for KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so as the komodo ecosystem grows, the usage of KMD grows, just within the ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is a network effect of N * N

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where each new project brings in their set of new people

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess there is no infographic to visualize this, yet it is still true

Author: willofleo#7505
Content: "new project brings in their set of new people" I referred to this in regards to growth in users of DEX

Author: willofleo#7505
Content: more porject more users more volume more project more users etc

Content: if people in the ecosystem are using KMD, then it is the base currency of the ecosystem

Content: and in private there must be a lot more
